Key Match Events: India comfortably reached 179-1 in 17 overs of the fourth T20 international after West Indies chose to bat first and scored 178-8.
Yashasvi Jaiswal hit 84 not out in 51 balls and Shubman Gill added 77 in 47 deliveries.
Shimron Hetmyer hit a 39-ball 61, including three fours and four sixes.
Kuldeep Yadav claimed two wickets for two runs in his first over, dismissing Nicholas Pooran and Rovman Powell.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The T20 games are taking place at an interesting time for the sport's prospects in the U.S., where Major League Cricket launched last month.
The T20 World Cup featuring the world’s best international teams is set to be co-hosted by the U.S. and West Indies next year.
